summary: This document is an email chain from September 2021 between a U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor and a U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) Task Force Officer. The prosecutor is requesting CBP travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, and specifically asks for records from the 1990s for a French female individual. The correspondence highlights ongoing investigative efforts to obtain travel data.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The prosecutor requests CBP travel records to see if any dates line up with her travel, indicating she is a central figure in the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The prosecutor requests CBP travel records to see if any dates line up with his travel, indicating his central role in the case.

persons.name: Jared
persons.context: Mentioned by a CBP Task Force Officer as having been briefed on the prosecutor's request for travel records.

connections.description: Both are named together as subjects for whom CBP travel records are being sought by prosecutors, indicating their linked investigative status.

events.title: Request for CBP Travel Records
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails a CBP Task Force Officer requesting travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell, Jeffrey Epstein, and a specific French female for the 1990s.

events.title: Initial CBP Contact
events.description: A CBP Task Force Officer responds to an initial inquiry from a prosecutor, indicating prior communication about the request for travel records.

keyFacts: Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York were actively seeking CBP travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein in September 2021.
The request specifically targeted travel records from the 1990s, indicating a focus on historical travel patterns.
The prosecutors also sought records for an unnamed French female individual, whose date of birth was referenced but redacted in the text.
The CBP officer noted a data limitation: for the timeframe in question, only inbound arrival records were available, as outbound departures were not recorded.
The communication is marked as Law Enforcement Sensitive/For Official Use Only, highlighting the confidential nature of the investigative request.
